description: Installation of hard standing and hedge to front following removal of existing concrete slab
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be commenced not later than three years from the date of this permission.
To comply with the requirements of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004).
The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out otherwise than in complete accordance with the approved plans (as set out on page one of this decision notice).
For the avoidance of doubt and to ensure that the development is carried out as approved.
The proposed development hereby approved shall be constructed in accordance with the materials and specifications detailed on the drawing nos. 'Plan 01' and 'Plan 02'.
Reason: To ensure that the appearance of the proposed development will harmonise with the character of the surrounding area.

The proposed hedge approved by drawing nos. 'Plan 01' and 'Plan 02' shall be carried out in the first planting season following completion of the development and any hedging which within a period of 5 years from completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of a similar size, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
To ensure that the development accords with Policy 30 of the Local Plan.

The hard surface hereby approved (including any sub-base) shall be made of porous materials or provision shall be made to direct run-off water from the hard surface to a permeable or porous area or surface within the curtilage of the dwellinghouse.
In order to ensure no water run-off from the hard surface which would contribute to risk of flooding.

Statement Required by Article 35(2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management) Order 2015: No significant problems were identified during the consideration of the application, and therefore it has been determined in accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework.
